title: (x) Kline Construction logo, similar to MVB Magnesium - Revue {Robert Trogman}
content:
I’ve got a client that is having some of their branding re-done, but they don’t have a clue who did this one or what the font is. Any help is greatly appreciated!

It’s the “KLINE” font I’m having trouble with. It’s pretty close to MVB Magnesium, but it has uniform strokes, whereas MVB Magnesium has a combination of broad/narrow strokes.

The “construction” font is Times New Roman bold.

Thanks for any help you can offer!

[URL=http://img58.imageshack.us/my.php?image=klineconstlogosmallxs0.png][IMG]http://img58.imageshack.us/img58/8157/klineconstlogosmallxs0.th.png[/IMG][/URL]

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [klinelogo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221305/http:/typophile.com/files/klinelogo.png) | 11.42 KB |

 [‹ (x) "Dental Studio" condensed sans - Solex {Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221305/http:/typophile.com/node/35573 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Name that script! - various {gang} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221305/http:/typophile.com/node/35310 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Keenjecter

comments.content: THE KLINE IS SET IN REVUE
That’s it! Thank you so very much!
